content:
1. 介绍 scan命令的作用和keys *的作用类似，主要用于查找 redis 中的键，但是在正式的生产环境中一般不会直接使用keys *这个命令，因为他会返回所有的键，如果键的数量很多会导致查询时间很长，进而导致服务器阻塞，所以需要 scan 来进行更细致的查找 scan总共有这几种命令：scan、sscan、hscan、zscan，分别用于迭代数据库中的：数据库中所有键、集合键、哈希键、有序集合键，命令具体结构如下：
scan cursor [MATCH pattern] [COUNT count] [TYPE type] sscan key cursor [MATCH pattern] [COUNT count] hscan key cursor [MATCH pattern] [COUNT count] zscan key cursor [MATCH pattern] [COUNT count] 2. scan scan cursor [MATCH pattern] [COUNT count] [TYPE type]，cursor 表示游标，指查询开始的位置，count 默认为 10，查询完后会返回下一个开始的游标，当返回 0 的时候表示所有键查询完了
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> scan 0 1) "3" 2) 1) "mystring" 2) "myzadd" 3) "myhset" 4) "mylist" 5) "myset2" 6) "myset1" 7) "mystring1" 8) "mystring3" 9) "mystring4" 10) "myset" 127.0.0.1:6379[2]> scan 3 1) "0" 2) 1) "myzadd1" 2) "mystring2" 3) "mylist2" 4) "myhset1" 5) "mylist1" MATCH 可以采用模糊匹配找出自己想要查找的键，这里的逻辑是先查出 20 个，再匹配，而不是先匹配再查询，这里加上 count 20 是因为默认查出的 10 个数中可能不能包含所有的相关项，所以把范围扩大到查 20 个，我这里测试的键总共有 15 个
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> scan 0 match mylist* count 20 1) "0" 2) 1) "mylist" 2) "mylist2" 3) "mylist1" TYPE 可以根据具体的结构类型来匹配该类型的键
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> scan 0 count 20 type list 1) "0" 2) 1) "mylist" 2) "mylist2" 3) "mylist1" 3. sscan sscan key cursor [MATCH pattern] [COUNT count]，sscan 的第一个参数总是集合类型的 key
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> sadd myset1 a b c d (integer) 4 127.0.0.1:6379[2]> smembers myset1 1) "d" 2) "a" 3) "c" 4) "b" 127.0.0.1:6379[2]> sscan myset1 0 1) "0" 2) 1) "d" 2) "c" 3) "b" 4) "a" 127.0.0.1:6379[2]> sscan myset1 0 match a 1) "0" 2) 1) "a" 4. hscan hscan key cursor [MATCH pattern] [COUNT count]，sscan 的第一个参数总是哈希类型的 key
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> hset myhset1 kk1 vv1 kk2 vv2 kk3 vv3 (integer) 3 127.0.0.1:6379[2]> hgetall myhset1 1) "kk1" 2) "vv1" 3) "kk2" 4) "vv2" 5) "kk3" 6) "vv3" 127.0.0.1:6379[2]> hscan myhset1 0 1) "0" 2) 1) "kk1" 2) "vv1" 3) "kk2" 4) "vv2" 5) "kk3" 6) "vv3" 5. zscan zscan key cursor [MATCH pattern] [COUNT count]，sscan 的第一个参数总是有序集合类型的 key
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> zadd myzadd1 1 zz1 2 zz2 3 zz3 (integer) 3 127.0.0.1:6379[2]> zrange myzadd1 0 -1 withscores 1) "zz1" 2) "1" 3) "zz2" 4) "2" 5) "zz3" 6) "3" 127.0.0.1:6379[2]> zscan myzadd1 0 1) "0" 2) 1) "zz1" 2) "1" 3) "zz2" 4) "2" 5) "zz3" 6) "3"
summary: 1. 介绍 scan命令的作用和keys *的作用类似，主要用于查找 redis 中的键，但是在正式的生产环境中一般不会直接使用keys *这个命令，因为他会返回所有的键，如果键的数量很多会导致查询时间很长，进而导致服务器阻塞，所以需要 scan 来进行更细致的查找 scan总共有这几种命令：scan、sscan
title: Redis scan

content:
EN The college entrance exam is over. The initial frenzy has gradually subsided into calm, so calm that it feels a bit empty.
The bookshelf is full of unopened books by Tsangyang Gyatso and Nalan Xingde, rewards I envisioned for myself during my second and third years of high school. But now, they are covered in dust. I’d rather gossip than glance at those literary books.
I opened “Ashes of Time,” and after five seconds, I clicked the red cross. Opened it again, and clicked again. The rough visuals deflated my once inflated expectations instantly. What a boring holiday!
I accidentally found a diary from after the class divisions in my third year of high school: “All for the college entrance exam.” “This is my first wish, and also the goal.” “Ten months left: end of summer, autumn, winter, spring, and then the exam.” “I want to end this summer perfectly.” “August 27, the first exam of the third year.” “Though I know it will be a bit rough, there’s no need to be discouraged.” “Every subject should get at least 80%. That way, I’ll get 600 points. What are you afraid of?” “You need to surpass yourself first, then others.” “I know you disdain many people, so you need to work harder.”
Even though it’s only been a year, the childish words from the past evoke some… feelings when read in today’s decadence. Is it… touching? Bitter? Or just sad?
More than ten years ago, that little girl with a runny nose could never have imagined having such arrogance when facing the college entrance exam. But after just two short days of tests, the paradise I imagined did not appear. I nervously checked answers, anxiously waited for scores, and ended up with a score as expressionless as mine.
In a daze, I enrolled in a school. I slept in until lunchtime every day. Occasionally, I passed by the high school in the evening. The sunset was crimson. Boys were sweating on the football field, girls sneaking out of school hurried back with dinners bought outside. Even the students doing cleaning were watched with envy by me. I leaned against those black iron bars and laughed for no reason.
How can I regain that scholarly spirit? If the third year of high school was a race, then my opening was grand, the process was calm, the climax was unforgettable, but the ending was a complete disaster.
CN 一场失败的角逐
高考完毕，当初的疯狂渐渐归于平静，静到有些空虚。
书架上满是未拆封的仓央嘉措、纳兰容若词传，那是高二、高三时憧憬着刑满释放给自己的嘉奖，而如今已蒙了尘。宁肯去八卦，也懒得再去看一眼那些文艺范儿的书。
点开《东邪西毒》，5 秒后，按了那个红叉。点开，又按。粗糙的画面让我原来膨胀的期望一下子泄了气。真是个无聊的假期呢！
无意中翻到高三分班后的日记： “一切为了高考。” “这是我的第一个愿望，也是目的。” “还有十个月，夏尾、秋、冬、春高考。” “这个夏尾，我要完美结束。 “8 月 27 日，第一次高三考试。“ “虽然知道会有些小惨，但不需要泄气。” “每门功课少说也得 80%吧。这样就够 600 分了，你还怕什么呢？” “你要超越的首先是自己，然后才是别人。” “我知道你不屑许多人，所以你要更努力。”
尽管过去仅仅 1 年，曾经稚气的话在颓废的今日读来竟有些……感动？苦涩？还是难过？
十多年前，那个吸拉着鼻涕的女孩肯定想不到，在面临高考时，她竟有这么一股傲气。只是短短两日的考验过去后，理想中的天堂似乎并没有来临。提着胆对答案，揪着心等分数，等到了一个和我一样面瘫的分数。
朦胧间报了学校，每天睡到午饭时间才起床。偶尔傍晚路过高中学校，夕阳绯红，有男生在足球场上挥汗，也有偷溜出校的女生提着校外晚餐匆匆赶回。就连做清洁的学生也被我用艳羡的目光盯着。我趴在那一根根黑色铁栏杆上，莫名地笑。
怎样才能再有那种书生意气？如果说高三是一场角逐，那我的开幕是壮阔的，过程是平静的，高潮是刻骨铭心的，只是这尾声，却是败得一塌糊涂。
summary: EN The college entrance exam is over. The initial frenzy has gradually subsided into calm, so calm that it feels a bit empty. The bookshelf is full of unopened books by Tsangyang Gyatso and Nalan Xingde, rewards I envisioned for myself during my second and third years of high school. But now, they are covered in dust. I’d rather gossip than glance at those literary books. I opened “Ashes of Time,” and after five seconds, I clicked the red cross. Opened it again, and clicked again. The rough visuals deflated my once inflated expectations instantly. What a boring holiday! I accidentally found a diary from after the class divisions in my third year of high school: “All for the college entrance exam.” “This is my first wish, and also the goal.” “Ten months left: end of summer, autumn, winter, spring,
title: A Failed Race
